body: what we used to check is both `dirtyFields` and `defaultValues`, but in the later version we focused on `defaultValues` for the sake of a single source of truth, but think twice, we may need to include that check just to make sure it's not breaking user's app, however, to be on the safe side, it's better to leave a defaultValues so within the hook, we can measure dirty correctly and bug free.

> This was not the case with 6.7.2

Looks like `6.8.3` was the last version where this worked as expected for me.

Seeing the same issue - it's behaving more like a `isTouched` rather that `isDirty`. For now, I'm working around it with:

```ts
  const isDirtyAlt = !!Object.keys(formState.dirtyFields).length;
```
hmmm, maybe we should keep the dirtyFields check internal as well... I will think about it, I was hoping to have a single source of truth.

It looks like this code is setting the `isDirty` flag right now:

```ts
  const isFormDirty = () =>
    !deepEqual(
      getValues(),
      isEmptyObject(defaultValuesRef.current)
        ? defaultValuesAtRenderRef.current
        : defaultValuesRef.current,
    );
```

Which means that (I think) if I've used `setValue` and explicitly set `shouldDirty: false`, the formState will still show `isDirty: true`

> It looks like this code is setting the `isDirty` flag right now:
> 
> ```ts
>   const isFormDirty = () =>
>     !deepEqual(
>       getValues(),
>       isEmptyObject(defaultValuesRef.current)
>         ? defaultValuesAtRenderRef.current
>         : defaultValuesRef.current,
>     );
> ```
> 
> Which means that (I think) if I've used `setValue` and explicitly set `shouldDirty: false`, the formState will still show `isDirty: true`

we used to have or not empty `dirtyFields`. I am thinking to revert that change...

Is this fix released? I'm on version 6.12.1 and running into this issue where `isDirty: true`, but `dirtyFields: {}`. It's specifically happening when I collapse a panel that's open by default. Something is triggering `isDirty` `true`, but the form itself appears unchanged when reviewing `getValues()`. I've tried with and without setting `defaultValues` with `useForm`, same result.

```
 {
    "isDirty": true,
    "dirtyFields": {},
    "isSubmitted": false,
    "submitCount": 0,
    "touched": {},
    "isSubmitting": false,
    "isSubmitSuccessful": false,
    "isValid": true,
    "errors": {}
}
```

@bluebill1049 I think my case may have more to do with the use of Material-UI's Accordion component. Still troubleshooting. Disregard my message. I'll follow up again if it looks like it's related to this library.

> @bluebill1049 I think my case may have more to do with the use of Material-UI's Accordion component. Still troubleshooting. Disregard my message. I'll follow up again if it looks like it's related to this library.

all good, let me know if anything i could help.

@bluebill1049 @Kizmar In my current project we are migrating from v5 to v6 and we've noticed that in a hundred places isDirty's just stopped working as expected. Are you suggesting to replace all `isDirty` with `!!Object.keys(dirtyFields).length` in the entire production-living application?

@mackankowski We were able to get past this issue without using the `dirtyFields` property. The issue we were having was related to how we were setting/re-setting form values as selection changed or something was re-rendered. This is entirely dependent on how things are built, so there isn't one answer or fix I can type up here.

@Kizmar thank you for answer! My motivation was to get rid of `isDirty` flag in entire applications and relying only on `dirtyFields`. I cannot see a value for `isDirty` after upgrading to v6, even if I have empty default values and I reset all the form inputs as soon as data is fetched from external service.

> @Kizmar thank you for answer! My motivation was to get rid of `isDirty` flag in entire applications and relying only on `dirtyFields`. I cannot see a value for `isDirty` after upgrading to v6, even if I have empty default values and I reset all the form inputs as soon as data is fetched from external service.

hey @mackankowski i have answered you in the other issue as well, always provide a `defualtValues` for hook form to compare with what's in your form. if this still not helping, fire a discussion provide a codesandbox, we can work this out.
